entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content: Starting, I thought I would mostly pay attention to MRR or MAU, but really the thing I‚Äôm the most proud about my app (@ShadowBoxingApp) is that after more than 2000 app store reviews, the score is still at 4.9/5 with consistent very positive feedback from users.

entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content:
The Figjam toolbar is a good example of form over function: it takes up a massive amount of space just to show a large illustration of a marker, and there isn‚Äôt any ‚Äúcompact‚Äù version of it.

Also, on a smaller screen instead of having smaller icons, you just get an ellipsis.

entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content:
The current iOS 16 beta has a bug so bad it would basically render @ShadowBoxingApp unusable.

I‚Äôm working to build some kind of fallback, but beyond saying ‚Äúsorry, everything is broken, can‚Äôt fix it‚Äù I don‚Äôt have many ideas.

I really really hope it‚Äôll be fixed on release.

entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content:
I always posted blog articles on my own site to keep ownership over the content I produced & to be able to display it how I wanted.

However, I never really paid attention to my microblogging on Twitter‚Ä¶ until recently! Given all of the changes made to the platform, I decided to store my previous tweets on my site as well. To do this, I‚Äôve migrated everything to Jekyll, but only kept the past few years online for now.

I‚Äôm not sure how I‚Äôll be posting from now on, or if this will be the most efficient move in terms of reach. I‚Äôll probably have to do a bunch of cross posting on X & Linkedin, but I like the idea of having everything I‚Äôm writing in a git repo so much I‚Äôm giving it a try anyways!

entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content: I‚Äôm still experimenting with this new way to share my status on my site. The main limitations are obviously interactions and reach. To fix this I‚Äôll probably figure out a good cross posting strategy and/or implement RSS.

entry.title: New status update from @marcgg
entry.content: I migrated from Pathogen to vim-plug, and now I don‚Äôt even know why I used Pathogen in the first place. It took me less than 15 minutes to have everything running and it looks so much nicer!
